intro: Lomatium foeniculaceum, commonly known as sweet everlasting, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its aromatic foliage and flowers are often used in herbal medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Lomatium foeniculaceum thrives in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes.
